requirements.summary: Apply the specified cyberpunk/futuristic military theme (palette, typography, ALL CAPS headings, console-like spacing) globally across the app.
acceptanceCriteria: All screens use the specified hex colors for backgrounds, cards, accents, success, and warning states.
Orbitron, Rajdhani, and Exo 2 are loaded and applied to the specified text categories.
Primary section headings render in ALL CAPS with increased letter spacing.
UI feels minimal, sharp, and console-like (no rounded bubbly components, no playful iconography).

file_operations.description: Create global styles defining the exact palette (#0B0F14, #111826, #00F0FF, #7A00FF, #00FF9C, #FF3B3B, #E6EDF3, #9FB3C8), typography mapping (Orbitron headings/day counter, Rajdhani buttons/labels, Exo 2 paragraphs/log text), ALL CAPS heading treatment, and console-like letter spacing (avoid playful rounded styling).
Load Orbitron, Rajdhani, and Exo 2 (e.g., via font links) and ensure the document defaults support the cyberpunk theme styling defined in frontend/src/index.css.
Align Tailwind theme tokens/variables so UI components can reference the exact specified hex colors consistently (background/card/primary/secondary/success/warning/text).

Create a mobile-first, console-like app layout wrapper (background, card surfaces, consistent padding/spacing) that all pages use. Use shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Card) for consistent surfaces; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Create Initialize screen to collect developer path and start date (default today), persist them locally, and route to Dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: If no prior initialization exists, the app opens on the Initialize screen.
Start date defaults to the user’s current local date.
After clicking INITIALIZE DAY 1, the app navigates to the Dashboard and the chosen start date persists across reloads/app restarts.
If already initialized, the app bypasses initialization (unless the user explicitly resets data via a separate reset control).

file_operations.description: Implement the Start/Initialize UI with title “DEV REBIRTH”, subtitle “Act like a developer. Become one.”, developer path input (free text + optional presets), start date input defaulting to today, and “INITIALIZE DAY 1” action. Use shadcn-ui form controls (Input, Select, Button, Card) for the console UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement local persistence helpers for initialization state (start date + developer path) using localStorage (and shared helpers for all logs/statistics later).
Create a central hook to read/write initialization state and expose derived flags (e.g., isInitialized) and setters used by routing and pages.
Add routing that opens Initialize when not initialized, and navigates to Dashboard after initialization. Ensure initialization bypass works when already initialized (unless reset is invoked).

Add an explicit reset control (e.g., in Dashboard/Settings area) that clears locally stored data and returns the app to Initialize. Use shadcn-ui Button + Dialog/AlertDialog to confirm; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement the Main Dashboard showing day count, today’s date, discipline status, dev progress, navigation to all screens, and a daily rotating quote.
acceptanceCriteria: Day count is derived from (today - startDate) + 1 using local dates.
Dashboard contains clear navigation to each required screen.
A quote is displayed and remains stable for a given date; it changes when the date changes.
Dev progress indicator updates based on today’s logged dev time (as dev logs are added/edited).

file_operations.description: Implement Dashboard UI: DAY counter (“DAY 01” style), “DAY X OF BECOMING A DEVELOPER”, today’s date, discipline status message, dev progress indicator, navigation buttons to MORNING/AFTERNOON/EVENING/NIGHT/REALITY CHECK/HISTORY/STATS & GROWTH, and a daily rotating discipline quote. Use shadcn-ui components (Button, Card, Progress) for consistent UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add local-date utilities for day index calculation, date keys, and formatting to avoid timezone issues (used by Dashboard, logs, History, Stats).
Create a deterministic daily quote selector (stable per local date, changes when date changes).
Wire Dashboard route and navigation targets for all required screens (including log sections, reality check, history, stats, summary).

requirements.summary: Implement Daily Dev Logging (Morning/Afternoon/Evening/Night) with required inputs, SAVE ENTRY, and per-section auto-save per day.
acceptanceCriteria: Each time section has its own saved entry per date (e.g., today+Morning).
SAVE ENTRY persists the entry and shows a clear saved state.
Auto-save writes changes without requiring manual save (with a visible “saved”/“saving” indicator).
Re-opening a section for the same date/time pre-fills with previously saved values.

file_operations.description: Create a single parameterized Dev Log page (section = Morning/Afternoon/Evening/Night) implementing: description, activity checkboxes, hours, relevance slider (0–10) with required label, focus level selector (Deep focus/Normal/Distracted), notes, SAVE ENTRY, plus autosave with visible saving/saved indicator. Use shadcn-ui components (Checkbox, Slider, RadioGroup/Select, Textarea, Button, Card) to match the console theme; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement local storage read/write for dev log entries keyed by date + time section; expose helpers to get/set, compute totals for a date, and update in-memory state for immediate UI updates.
Create a reusable autosave hook that debounces writes, tracks 'saving'/'saved' states, and is safe for per-date/per-section forms.
Register routes for MORNING LOG / AFTERNOON LOG / EVENING LOG / NIGHT LOG and ensure Dashboard navigation opens the correct section.

requirements.summary: Show Daily Summary after completing Night log, computing totals/averages/focus rating and mapping to the required performance message.
acceptanceCriteria: Daily Summary appears after saving the Night log (and is accessible later via History).
Total dev hours equals the sum of dev hours across all four dev sections for the date.
Average relevance is computed from available relevance entries for the date (ignoring missing sections).
A deterministic rule maps the day’s performance to High/Medium/Low and displays the exact specified message text.

file_operations.description: Implement Daily Summary view for a selected date (default today) showing total dev hours, average relevance (ignore missing sections), overall focus rating, and the exact message for High/Medium/Low outcomes. Use shadcn-ui Card/Badge for clear console-like readouts; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add deterministic scoring logic to compute daily totals, average relevance, focus rating aggregation, and mapping to High/Medium/Low (with exact message strings).
After a successful SAVE ENTRY on the Night section, route to the Daily Summary for that date.
Add a route for Daily Summary and ensure it can be reached after Night save and from History.

requirements.summary: Implement Reality Check dashboard page with today’s dev vs non-dev totals, comparison bar, pie chart, and required message logic.
acceptanceCriteria: Reality Check page shows today’s computed totals for dev and non-dev hours.
Comparison bar uses success color for dev and warning color for non-dev.
Pie chart renders a correct distribution based on today’s non-dev activities (and optionally dev vs non-dev).
Message matches the specified rule and uses the exact wording.

file_operations.description: Implement Reality Check page showing today’s dev hours, non-dev hours, green(success)-vs-red(warning) comparison bar, pie chart distribution, and exact message logic (“DISCIPLINE DOMINATES.” vs “REALITY CHECK: DISTRACTIONS DOMINATE.”). Use shadcn-ui components (Card, Progress) for console UI; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a pie chart component for time distribution (non-dev breakdown and/or dev vs non-dev). Prefer a lightweight React chart library already compatible with the template; integrate via a dedicated component. If using shadcn-ui chart patterns or wrappers, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add/adjust frontend dependencies needed to render the pie chart and weekly/monthly charts (e.g., a React charting library) while keeping the app mobile-performant.
Add route and navigation wiring for REALITY CHECK from Dashboard and global navigation.

requirements.summary: Add ‘Log Non-Dev Activity’ form on Reality Check page, persist multiple entries per date, and update totals/analytics immediately.
acceptanceCriteria: User can add multiple non-dev entries per date.
Time spent supports hours and minutes and is summed accurately into a single non-dev total for the date.
Saved entries persist across reloads/app restarts.
Reality Check totals update immediately after saving an entry.

file_operations.description: Implement the non-dev activity form with required fields (type, hours/minutes, category, mood after, notes) and SAVE ENTRY. Use shadcn-ui form components (Select, Input, Textarea, Button, Card) for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement local persistence for non-dev entries (multiple per date), accurate duration normalization (hours+minutes), and selectors to compute daily totals and breakdowns by type/category.
Embed the NonDevLogForm and render today’s non-dev entries list; refresh totals and charts immediately after save using shared state selectors.

requirements.summary: Add Reality Analytics on Reality Check page: weekly distraction hours, most common distraction, discipline score %, tier label, and warning when today’s distraction > 4h.
acceptanceCriteria: Weekly distraction hours aggregates the last 7 days (including today) of non-dev time.
Most common distraction identifies the activity type with the greatest total duration over the selected period (default last 7 days).
Discipline score percentage is computed and displayed with the correct tier label.
If today’s non-dev time > 4 hours, the exact warning text is shown prominently.

file_operations.description: Create analytics panel for Reality Check: weekly distraction hours (last 7 days), most common distraction (by total duration), discipline score = dev/(dev+non-dev) %, tier label (HIGHLY DISCIPLINED / IMPROVING / LOSING CONTROL), and warning banner when today’s non-dev time > 4 hours with exact text “WARNING: YOU ARE SLIPPING.”. Use shadcn-ui Card/Badge/Alert styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement aggregation helpers for last-7-days totals, most common distraction calculation, discipline % computation, and tier mapping (deterministic).
Wire RealityAnalytics into the Reality Check page and ensure it recomputes from persisted state when entries/dev logs change.

requirements.summary: Create History screen to select a date and view dev logs + non-dev logs for that date, including day number and dev hours.
acceptanceCriteria: User can navigate to History and choose a past date.
Selected date shows the four dev sections (if present) and all non-dev entries for that date.
Day number is displayed for the selected date based on stored start date.
Dev hours shown match the sum of the date’s dev section hours.

file_operations.description: Implement History page with date selection (calendar or list) and a detail view that shows: day number relative to start date, dev hours for that day, dev logs by section, and all non-dev entries. Use shadcn-ui components (Tabs/Accordion/Card/Button) for a mobile-friendly drill-down; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a mobile-friendly date selector (calendar or list) suitable for choosing any date with data. Use shadcn-ui date picker patterns if available; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a route for HISTORY and ensure it is reachable from Dashboard navigation.

requirements.summary: Create Stats & Growth screen with computed totals, streaks, weekly chart, monthly discipline %, and badges.
acceptanceCriteria: Totals and averages are computed from persisted logs (not hard-coded).
Longest streak is computed from consecutive days with non-zero dev hours (define “no zero day” consistently across the app).
Weekly and monthly visualizations render and match computed values.
Badges unlock based on the specified thresholds and remain unlocked once earned.

file_operations.description: Implement Stats & Growth UI showing: total days tracked, total dev hours, average relevance, longest streak, weekly chart, monthly discipline %, and badge grid (7 day streak, 30 day streak, 100 hours learning, no zero days streak). Use shadcn-ui Card/Badge/Progress for console-like readouts; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a weekly chart component (last 7 days) for dev/non-dev and/or discipline % trends, using the same chart library chosen for Reality charts. If using shadcn-ui chart patterns, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement computations for totals, averages, longest streak (consecutive days with dev hours > 0), monthly discipline % aggregation, and badge unlocking rules with persistent unlocked state.
Persist badge/streak state locally and ensure badges remain unlocked once earned while still recomputing live stats from logs.
Add a route for STATS & GROWTH and ensure it is reachable from Dashboard navigation.

requirements.summary: Implement persistent local storage for initialization, dev logs, non-dev logs, streaks/badges, and stats inputs so data persists across restarts.
acceptanceCriteria: After reload or browser restart, all previously entered data remains available.
Initialization status is preserved (start date and developer path persist).
History and Stats reflect the persisted dataset accurately.

file_operations.description: Expand storage layer to cover: start date, developer path, dev logs, non-dev logs, and badge/streak state with versioning/migration safeguards to avoid breaking existing saved data.
Ensure dev log state is hydrated from local storage on app load and writes back on save/autosave.
Ensure non-dev log state is hydrated from local storage on app load and writes back on save.
Ensure badge/streak state is hydrated and persisted; keep computed stats derived from logs consistent across reloads.
Initialize app state providers (if needed) so pages render from hydrated local data before computing day counts, history lists, and stats.

requirements.summary: Add in-app reminder system UI showing one of four daily reminder texts based on local time (no push services).
acceptanceCriteria: The app shows the correct reminder text for the current part of the day when the user opens the app.
Reminders are visible somewhere appropriate (e.g., dashboard banner) and use the specified exact text.
No external messaging/push infrastructure is required for the reminders to function as an in-app system.

file_operations.description: Implement an in-app reminder banner that selects and displays the exact text for the current local time segment: Morning “START BUILDING”, Afternoon “STAY RELEVANT”, Evening “KEEP PROGRESSING”, Night “LOG YOUR REALITY”. Use shadcn-ui Alert/Card styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add deterministic local-time mapping logic (morning/afternoon/evening/night) used by the reminder UI.
Render ReminderBanner in a prominent dashboard location and ensure it updates appropriately when the app is opened (and optionally on an interval while open).

requirements.summary: Provide cohesive, mobile-first navigation across all required screens (Initialize, Dashboard, Dev Logs, Daily Summary, Reality Check, History, Stats & Growth).
acceptanceCriteria: All required screens are reachable through obvious navigation elements.
Mobile viewport layout is usable with touch-friendly targets.
Routing/state preserves the currently selected date/section where relevant (e.g., opening a specific log section from Dashboard).

file_operations.description: Implement the full mobile-first routing map and ensure navigation preserves section/date context (e.g., log section route params; history date query/params; summary date).

Create a touch-friendly bottom navigation (or compact console nav) for key areas (Dashboard, Reality Check, History, Stats). Use shadcn-ui Button and icon strategy consistent with non-playful console style; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire global layout + navigation container so every screen is consistently wrapped and mobile-friendly.
Ensure dashboard navigation buttons route to the correct screens and preserve date/section state where relevant.

requirements.summary: Define deterministic discipline status message and today’s dev progress logic on Dashboard based on today’s logs (time, relevance, focus).
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard status message changes based on today’s data (e.g., no logs vs some logs vs strong day) and is deterministic.
Progress indicator updates as logs are saved/edited for today.
No placeholder/mock values remain once logging is implemented.

file_operations.description: Add/extend deterministic logic to derive (for today): status message selection rules, progress calculation from dev hours/relevance/focus, and any normalization thresholds used consistently throughout the app.
Replace any placeholder values with computed values from persisted dev logs: discipline status message and today’s dev progress indicator update reactively when logs change.
Expose selectors for today’s computed aggregates (total hours, average relevance, focus distribution) used by Dashboard and Reality analytics.

requirements.summary: Apply console-like, brutally honest English copy across the UI using provided phrases verbatim and ALL CAPS headings.
acceptanceCriteria: All specified phrases appear exactly as written in the UI.
Primary headings use ALL CAPS styling.
No non-English UI strings are introduced.

file_operations.description: Centralize required verbatim phrases (e.g., “REALITY CHECK”, “DISCIPLINE SCORE”, summary messages, Reality Check messages) and shared labels to prevent accidental wording drift and ensure English-only UI strings.
Update dashboard headings/labels to use the centralized copy and ensure ALL CAPS heading styling is applied consistently.
Ensure Reality Check headings and messages use the exact specified wording via centralized copy.
Ensure summary performance messages use the exact specified strings via centralized copy.
Ensure global typography and heading styles enforce ALL CAPS for main headings and consistent letter spacing without altering required verbatim phrases.

requirements.summary: Add required generated static image assets (logo and HUD background texture) under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them subtly in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Logo/texture are used subtly to reinforce the cyberpunk military console theme without reducing readability.
The app remains performant on mobile-sized viewports with the added imagery.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset as specified (cyan/violet on transparent background).
Add the generated subtle HUD/grid background texture as specified (dark cyber-black/blue with faint cyan lines).

Render the static logo from frontend/public/assets/generated/dev-rebirth-logo.dim_512x512.png and apply the subtle HUD texture from frontend/public/assets/generated/dev-rebirth-hud-bg.dim_1440x2560.png in a readability-safe way (no backend serving).

Apply the HUD/background texture globally where appropriate using frontend/public/assets/generated/dev-rebirth-hud-bg.dim_1440x2560.png and include subtle logo placement where it reinforces branding without harming legibility.
